title: Re-add Demo & Media image asset to production build

requirements.summary: Ship the uploaded Demo & Media image in frontend static assets at the exact path referenced by siteConfig so it loads under non-root base paths and preserves click-to-open behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains `frontend/public/assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` (from the uploaded image, either via rename or copy).

In `frontend/src/siteConfig.ts`, `siteConfig.media.images` continues to reference a path that exists in `frontend/public` at build time (either unchanged if `assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` is created, or updated to the actual shipped filename).

When the app is built and deployed under a non-root base path, the Demo & Media image renders without triggering the "Image failed to load" fallback in `frontend/src/components/sections/DemoMediaSection.tsx`.
Clicking the image opens the full-size image in a new tab (existing behavior remains working).

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded image asset to the public static assets so the deployed build includes it at the exact path referenced by config. Source should be the uploaded file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-06 at 9.23.49 AM-1.jpeg" (copy/rename into this canonical filename).

Verify `siteConfig.media.images` references `assets/whatsapp-image-2026-02-06-092349.jpeg` (or adjust only if the shipped filename/path differs) so the referenced path exists under `frontend/public` at build time and resolves correctly via the existing base-path-aware URL resolver.
